title: Prepare and publish the latest build so the live app reflects current behavior

requirements.text: Add a clear, repo-local deployment guide and scripts so the latest frontend + backend can be deployed to the Internet Computer and the deployed URL can be retrieved reliably.

quotes: push the changes to live so i can see the app behaviour

acceptanceCriteria: A root-level deployment document exists (e.g., DEPLOYMENT.md) that explains how to deploy using dfx, including prerequisites, build steps, deploy steps, and how to obtain the live canister URL.
Package scripts (or equivalent documented commands) exist for: building the frontend assets, deploying canisters, and printing the deployed frontend URL.
Following the guide from a clean checkout results in a successful deploy without requiring undocumented manual steps.

requirements.text: Expose a visible app build identifier in the UI so the user can confirm the live site is running the newest deployment.

quotes: push the changes to live so i can see the app behaviour

acceptanceCriteria: The app displays a build identifier (e.g., version/commit/timestamp) in a non-intrusive location (such as the footer area within the MobileShell layout).
The build identifier is set at build time (not hardcoded in the component) so it changes across deployments.
The identifier is readable on mobile and in both light/dark themes.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add migration.mo if state upgrades are introduced.

Do not edit frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and anything under frontend/src/components/ui; compose around them instead.
nonGoals: Implementing the backend persistence/editing UI for profile details (About Me, Past Years, Future Plans).
Adding any new sections or changing the existing profile content structure beyond what is needed for deployment/version visibility.
